summary:
Dr. Richard Plat AAG RBA is currently partner of 'Risk at Work Consulting', specialised in quantitative risk consultancy for insurers, pension funds and banks. Richard holds a Master of Science degree (1999) and PhD (2011) in Actuarial Science at the University of Amsterdam and successfully finished postdoctoral studies for actuary of the Dutch actuarial society (AAG) and investment analyst (RBA / CEFA). He combines more than 20 years of practical experience with a thorough technical knowledge. This allows him to quickly see through complex issues, place it in a broader context and finding a suitable and practical solution for it. He has been involved in Solvency 2, Market Consistent Embedded Value , Economic Capital, Asset Liability Management, pricing, hedging, valuation of embedded options, stochastic modeling of market and insurance risks, replicating portfolios, IFRS 4 Phase 2 (predecessor IFRS 17), model validation and review, IFRS 9, Mergers & Acquisitions and many more. Furthermore, he has experience with R, Python, SAS,  Visual Basic, Matlab, Prophet, Barrie & Hibbert and ORTEC.

Besides that he finished his PhD thesis in 2010 called ‘Essays on Valuation and Risk Management for Insurers’. This PhD thesis presents scientific research on different areas of valuation and risk management. Several papers coming from this thesis are published in the highest ranked scientific actuarial journals, but are also practically applicable within insurers. He also published several articles in more practical oriented actuarial magazines and has been speaker at several seminars and workshops on different topics, amongst others on Data Science and Machine Learning.

Apart from the experience mentioned above he is also reviewer for the highest ranked scientific actuarial journals and member of the jury for the Johan de Witt price.
